circumstances:
The crew departed RAF Worthy Down on a local training mission. On approach, at an altitude of 700 feet, the pilot-in-command throttled back the engine. The airplane lost height, causing the left wing to hit the station headquarter building and crashed. Three crew members were killed and a fourth occupant was injured as well as nine people on the building. 
Crew:
F/O Walter Sydney Monroe, †
F/O John Barton, †
LAC James Stanley Milner, †
F/O John Rene Whitley.
